info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 16 at 2:02PM EDT until May 16 at 9:08PM EDT by NWS Mount Holly NJ
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania...
East Branch Brandywine Creek Below Downingtown affecting Chester County.
For the Brandywine Creek...including Downingtown...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...East Branch Brandywine Creek below Downingtown.
* WHEN...From this afternoon to late this evening.
* IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Open adjacent land next to the creek floods. At 8.0 feet, Dowlin Forge Road begins to flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM EDT Friday the stage was 6.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage to 7.1 feet late this afternoon. Water levels will decrease tonight. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.2 feet on 03/01/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around...don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi.
The next statement will be issued this evening at 915 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE THIS EVENING
